news-item.title: Keystone pipeline protest
news-item.text: About 400 demonstrators, mostly college students, were arrested protesting against the proposed Keystone XL pipeline in front of the White House Sunday, authorities said. Several of the protesters sprawled on a black plastic tarp representing an oil spill (above). The Keystone expansion would carry 800,000 barrels a day of crude oil from Canada to the Gulf of Mexico. Opponents contend the pipeline, which is awaiting approval of President Obama, would further expand harmful effects of climate change attributed to the use and extraction of fossil fuels.
